Naruto Uzumaki.summary: Chūnin Exams finals. Naruto overcame Neji's Gentle Fist using the Nine-Tails' chakra and won with an underground clone surprise attack, proving destiny can be changed.
During Konoha Crush, Naruto summoned Gamabunta to battle Gaara's Shukaku transformation. Naruto headbutted the awakened Gaara to win and changed his worldview.
Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Naruto accidentally won by passing gas, disrupting Kiba's enhanced senses, then defeated him with the Uzumaki Barrage.
Final Valley battle. Naruto in One-Tail form clashed with Sasuke's Curse Mark Level 2. Their Rasengan and Chidori collided, but Sasuke left victorious yet spared Naruto's life.
Pain's Assault on Konoha. Naruto mastered Sage Mode to defeat the Six Paths of Pain, then convinced Nagato to revive those he killed through Talk no Jutsu.
Naruto debuted the Rasenshuriken, destroying two of Kakuzu's hearts and leaving him for Kakashi to finish. A major growth moment for Naruto.
Fourth Shinobi War. Naruto used Sage Mode to redirect the Third Raikage's own Hell Stab technique against himself, exploiting the scar on his chest.
Naruto and the Allied Forces fought Obito as the Ten-Tails' jinchūriki. Naruto's words reached Obito, causing him to abandon his plan and help seal Kaguya.
Fourth Shinobi War. Naruto with Six Paths Sage Mode fought Madara but couldn't defeat him before Madara activated the Infinite Tsukuyomi.
Naruto and Sasuke combined their Six Paths powers to seal Kaguya using the Six Paths — Chibaku Tensei, ending the Fourth Shinobi War.
Multiple encounters. In Four-Tails form, Naruto nearly killed Orochimaru at the Tenchi Bridge, but Orochimaru escaped using substitution.
After Tsunade search arc, Naruto hit Kabuto with a Rasengan but Kabuto's regeneration saved him. Both were incapacitated but survived.
Training match where Naruto's massive chakra reserves and clones overwhelmed Shino's insect techniques.
During training, Naruto's Nine-Tails chakra erupted beyond Yamato's wood-style suppression abilities, requiring intervention.
Bell test rematch. Naruto and Sakura worked together against Kakashi and succeeded in taking a bell, proving their growth.
Training session at Falls of Truth. Killer B helped Naruto master the Nine-Tails' chakra through intense sparring matches.

Sasuke Uchiha.summary: Final Valley battle. Sasuke's Chidori overpowered Naruto's Rasengan, but he chose not to kill his friend, abandoning his headband and leaving for Orochimaru.
Land of Waves. Sasuke awakened his Sharingan protecting Naruto from Haku's ice mirrors but was seemingly killed, triggering Naruto's Nine-Tails power.
Chūnin Exams finals. Sasuke debuted Chidori and pierced Gaara's sand armor, but the match was interrupted by the Konoha Crush invasion.
Forest of Death. Orochimaru applied the Curse Mark to Sasuke after easily defeating him, beginning Sasuke's corruption.
Sasuke tracked Deidara after Itachi's trail. Using Sharingan genjutsu and Lightning Release to counter Deidara's explosives, Sasuke survived Deidara's suicide bombing.
Battle between brothers. Sasuke used all his techniques but Itachi, already dying from illness, let Sasuke win to transfer his powers and free him from Orochimaru.
Taka attacked B to capture him for Akatsuki. B's Eight-Tails power overwhelmed the team, and B only pretended to be captured to escape Kumo.
Five Kage Summit. A attacked Sasuke for targeting his brother. Sasuke's Susanoo blocked A's attacks, but Gaara intervened before a conclusion.
Sasuke cornered Danzō to avenge the Uchiha clan. He broke through Izanagi and killed Danzō, who failed to take Sasuke with him using his suicide seal.
Itachi and Sasuke fought together against Kabuto's Sage Mode. Itachi used Izanami to trap Kabuto in a loop, forcing him to release the Edo Tensei.
Fourth Shinobi War. Sasuke with Rinnegan fought Madara but couldn't prevent the Infinite Tsukuyomi's activation. Later cooperated against Kaguya.
Sasuke and Naruto used Six Paths powers to seal Kaguya. Sasuke's Rinnegan dimension-shifting was crucial to the final sealing.
Before Chūnin Exams. Rock Lee challenged Sasuke and easily outpaced his Sharingan with pure taijutsu speed, humbling the Uchiha prodigy.
Orochimaru's hideout. Sasuke easily overwhelmed Sai with his superior speed and power, demonstrating his growth under Orochimaru.
Orochimaru's hideout. Sasuke's Chidori current paralyzed the entire Team Kakashi including Yamato, showing his overwhelming power.

Sakura Haruno.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Childhood rivals fought to mutual knockout. Both put everything into final punches that connected simultaneously.
Sakura and Chiyo fought Sasori in his Akatsuki hideout. Sakura's antidotes and superhuman strength helped defeat the puppet master, with Sasori allowing his death.

Kakashi Hatake.summary: First major fight of the series. Kakashi copied Zabuza's techniques and trapped him with the Water Dragon Jutsu, later killing him on the bridge.
Itachi's return to Konoha. Kakashi was caught in Tsukuyomi and experienced 72 hours of torture in seconds, requiring weeks of recovery.
Kakashi pierced one of Kakuzu's hearts with Lightning Blade but was overwhelmed by his multiple hearts until Naruto arrived.
Pain's Assault. Kakashi fought the Deva Path to protect Chōji but died using Kamui to save Chōji from a missile, later revived by Nagato.
Former teammates battled in the Kamui dimension. Kakashi stabbed Obito through the heart, winning their emotional confrontation over ideals.
Obito gave Kakashi both his Sharingan before dying. Kakashi manifested Perfect Susanoo and helped Team 7 seal Kaguya.
Kakashi's Lightning Blade killed Haku, who jumped in front of Zabuza to take the fatal blow meant for his master.
Itachi and Kisame confronted Kakashi in Konoha. Might Guy arrived before a real battle developed, causing them to retreat.
Kakashi used Kamui to warp away Deidara's explosive clay, losing his arm. The fight was interrupted before conclusion.
Bell test rematch. Kakashi tested Naruto and Sakura's growth, and they successfully worked together to claim the bells.

Might Guy.summary: Guy used the Seventh Gate to defeat Kisame's Samehada fusion form with Hirudora, avenging their previous encounters.
Guy opened all Eight Gates to fight Ten-Tails Madara. His Night Guy technique nearly killed Madara, who called him the strongest taijutsu user.
Eternal rivals with 50-49 record. Their competitions range from rock-paper-scissors to racing, never having a decisive combat victory.
Guy trained Lee personally, always remaining one step ahead as his master while teaching him the Eight Gates technique.
As Team Guy's sensei, Guy trained alongside Neji but never had a definitive battle, respecting each other's styles.
Training sessions where Guy's taijutsu mastery always overcame Tenten's weapons expertise.

Rock Lee.summary: Pre-Chūnin Exams challenge. Lee's speed overwhelmed Sasuke's Sharingan completely, only stopped by Guy before using forbidden techniques.
Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Lee opened Five Gates and nearly won with Primary Lotus and Hidden Lotus, but Gaara's sand crushed his arm and leg.
Sasuke Retrieval arc. Lee fought while still recovering and intoxicated on medicine. Kimimaro's bone techniques overwhelmed him until Gaara arrived.
Friendly sparring matches where both pushed each other. Neither achieved a decisive victory in their training battles.
Academy and team sparring. Neji's Gentle Fist and Byakugan gave him consistent advantages over Lee in their training matches.
Team Guy training. Lee's close-combat taijutsu overcame Tenten's ranged weapons style in their sparring sessions.

Neji Hyūga.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Neji brutally defeated his cousin, nearly killing her while ranting about destiny and the Branch Family's fate.
Chūnin Exams finals. Despite dominating early, Naruto's Nine-Tails chakra and underground clone attack defeated Neji, changing his worldview.
Sasuke Retrieval arc. Neji figured out Kidōmaru's spider techniques and survived a nearly fatal arrow wound to deliver the killing blow.
Team training and Academy sparring. Neji's Byakugan and Gentle Fist gave him advantages in most matches against Lee.
Team training where Neji's Rotation deflected Tenten's weapons and his Gentle Fist closed the distance effectively.

Gaara.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Despite Lee's incredible speed with the Gates, Gaara's sand armor and Shield of Sand prevailed, crushing Lee's limbs.
Konoha Crush. Naruto summoned Gamabunta to fight Shukaku and headbutted Gaara awake, defeating him and changing his heart through understanding.
Deidara attacked Suna to capture Gaara. Gaara protected the village but lost consciousness blocking a massive explosion. Akatsuki extracted Shukaku.
Sasuke Retrieval arc. Gaara arrived to save Lee and trapped Kimimaro, who died from his illness just before delivering a fatal blow.
Fourth Shinobi War. Gaara sealed the Edo Tensei Second Mizukage after an extended battle exploiting his giant clam genjutsu weakness.
Chūnin Exams finals. Sasuke's Chidori pierced Gaara's sand, but the invasion interrupted before a true conclusion.

Shikamaru Nara.summary: Revenge for Asuma. Shikamaru trapped Hidan with explosive tags and shadow techniques, burying him alive in the Nara forest forever.
Sasuke Retrieval arc. Shikamaru's Shadow Possession trapped Tayuya, but Temari arrived to finish her with Summoning: Quick Beheading Dance.
Chūnin Exams finals. Shikamaru strategically outmaneuvered Temari but forfeited due to low chakra, despite having her trapped.

Choji Akimichi.summary: Sasuke Retrieval arc. Choji used the three colored pills, transforming into Butterfly Mode to kill Jirōbō with Butterfly Bullet Bombing.
Choji's expansion techniques helped distract Kakuzu but couldn't damage him significantly before Naruto's arrival.
Fourth Shinobi War. Edo Tensei Asuma fought his students. Choji couldn't attack his sensei until Asuma's words freed him to use Butterfly Mode.

Ino Yamanaka.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Former best friends clashed with everything they had, knocking each other out simultaneously.
Team dynamics and training. Ino and Sai developed a relationship through missions rather than combat.
Ino provided support during the Team 10 battle against Kakuzu, using Mind Transfer for reconnaissance rather than direct combat.

Hinata Hyūga.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Neji's hatred of the Main Family drove him to nearly kill Hinata despite her brave refusal to give up.
Pain's Assault. Hinata confessed her love to Naruto and attacked Pain to protect him, but was easily defeated and nearly killed.

Kiba Inuzuka.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Kiba underestimated Naruto, who accidentally used flatulence to disrupt Kiba's senses and won with Uzumaki Barrage.
Sasuke Retrieval arc. Kiba and Akamaru nearly died fighting the twin brothers until Kankurō arrived with his puppets.
Training and team exercises where neither decisively defeated the other.

Shino Aburame.summary: Chūnin Exams finals. Shino's bugs infiltrated Kankurō's puppets and body, forcing him to forfeit before being consumed.

Tenten.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Temari's wind techniques completely countered Tenten's weapons, defeating her without taking any damage.
Fourth Shinobi War. Tenten used the Treasured Tools of the Sage of Six Paths against Kakuzu's Edo Tensei, providing support.

Kurenai Yūhi.summary: Itachi's return to Konoha. Kurenai tried genjutsu on Itachi, who instantly reversed it, nearly killing her before Kakashi intervened.
Confrontation alongside Asuma. They stalled the Akatsuki duo until Guy arrived, avoiding direct combat with Kisame.

Asuma Sarutobi.summary: Itachi's return to Konoha. Asuma fought alongside Kurenai but they were outmatched by Itachi's Sharingan abilities.
Asuma's chakra blades clashed with Samehada, but Guy arrived before the fight could conclude.
Akatsuki Suppression arc. Asuma was overwhelmed by Kakuzu's multiple hearts and elemental techniques.
Akatsuki Suppression arc. Hidan's curse ritual killed Asuma after ingesting his blood, dying with final words to his students.

Yamato.summary: Orochimaru's hideout. Yamato was paralyzed by Sasuke's Chidori current along with the rest of Team Kakashi.
Multiple encounters. Yamato's Wood Release clashed with Kabuto's regeneration abilities without decisive victory.
Yamato suppressed Naruto's Nine-Tails during training but couldn't fully control the Four-Tails transformation.
Team dynamics where Yamato led rather than fought against Sai.

Sai.summary: Orochimaru's hideout. Sai attempted to complete his mission but was defeated by Sasuke's overwhelming power.
Sai's ink birds pursued Deidara during the Gaara rescue, providing reconnaissance rather than engaging directly.
Sai encountered Sasori's techniques during missions but had limited direct combat.
Team leadership dynamics rather than actual combat between them.
Romantic relationship development rather than combat encounters.

Jiraiya.summary: Multiple encounters as former teammates. Their Sannin battle left Jiraiya with a scar across his chest from Orochimaru's sword.
Legendary Sannin never had decisive combat. Their confrontation during Tsunade's recruitment was brief.
Itachi and Kisame retreated when Jiraiya arrived in Konoha, avoiding direct confrontation with the Sannin.
Jiraiya infiltrated Rain Village and fought the Six Paths of Pain. He discovered Pain's secret but was killed, writing a coded message on Fukasaku.
Second Shinobi War. The three Sannin survived against Hanzō, earning their title. Hanzō spared them impressed by their strength.

Orochimaru.summary: Konoha Crush. Orochimaru killed his teacher with the Reaper Death Seal taking both their souls, though Hiruzen sealed Orochimaru's arms.
Multiple encounters as rivals. Their Sannin battle left lasting scars on both, neither achieving decisive victory.
Sannin showdown. Orochimaru couldn't defeat Tsunade despite her fear of blood, and retreated when Jiraiya joined.
Tenchi Bridge. Orochimaru faced Naruto's Four-Tails form and was nearly killed but escaped using substitution.
Sasuke absorbed Orochimaru when Orochimaru attempted the body transfer, claiming his powers for himself.
Orochimaru tried to steal Itachi's body but was trapped in genjutsu instantly. Itachi severed his hand, forcing his departure from Akatsuki.
Kabuto absorbed Orochimaru's remains and consciousness, becoming the dominant personality in their merged form.
Orochimaru defeated his former student with ease, her Curse Mark being a fraction of his power.

Tsunade.summary: Sannin showdown. Tsunade overcame her hemophobia to protect Naruto and fought Orochimaru until he retreated.
Tsunade used her medical knowledge to adapt to Kabuto's attacks and defeated him with her superhuman strength.
Five Kage Summit. Madara's Perfect Susanoo overwhelmed all Five Kage. Tsunade was bisected but survived through Byakugō.
Sannin never had serious combat against each other, maintaining their bond as teammates.
Fourth Shinobi War. Tsunade and the Kage fought Edo Tensei Madara, not directly confronting Nagato.

Itachi Uchiha.summary: Konoha infiltration. Itachi trapped Kakashi in Tsukuyomi, torturing him for 72 hours in seconds and incapacitating him for weeks.
Itachi instantly reversed Kurenai's genjutsu, demonstrating his absolute mastery of the art.
Konoha infiltration. Asuma and Kurenai were no match for Itachi's Sharingan abilities.
Itachi and Kisame retreated rather than fight Jiraiya, acknowledging the Sannin's power.
Itachi fought Sasuke at the Uchiha hideout. Already dying, he let Sasuke win to free him from the Curse Mark and transfer Amaterasu.
When Orochimaru tried to steal his body, Itachi severed his hand and trapped him in genjutsu, forcing him out of Akatsuki.
Edo Tensei Itachi used Izanami to trap Kabuto in a loop, forcing him to release the technique and accept himself.
Deidara's hatred for Itachi stemmed from losing to his genjutsu, which made his artistic explosions completely ineffective.

Kisame Hoshigaki.summary: Konoha infiltration. Brief clash of Asuma's chakra blades versus Samehada before Guy's arrival.
Kisame fell to Guy's Hirudora technique after fusing with Samehada. Earlier encounters also favored Guy.
Kisame was decapitated by B's Lariat, though it was revealed to be a clone. Later captured for intelligence.
Partners in Akatsuki. Kisame respected Itachi deeply and never fought him seriously.
Brief encounter in Konoha where they retreated before fighting seriously.

Deidara.summary: Deidara attacked Sunagakure and defeated Gaara by exploiting his duty to protect the village. Gaara sacrificed himself to block a massive explosion.
Gaara rescue mission. Naruto and Kakashi pursued Deidara but he escaped using a suicide clone.
Deidara's art was countered by Sasuke's Lightning Release and Sharingan. In desperation, Deidara used C0 suicide bombing, but Sasuke survived.
Deidara was recruited to Akatsuki after losing to Itachi's genjutsu, sparking his hatred for the Sharingan.
Deidara captured the Five-Tails jinchūriki Han for Akatsuki using his explosive clay techniques.

Sasori.summary: Sakura and Chiyo fought Sasori in his hideout. Despite his 100 puppet army, they destroyed his core. Sasori allowed his death, choosing to join his parents.
Sasori easily defeated Kankurō during the Gaara rescue, poisoning him with techniques Kankurō couldn't match.
Sasori's grandmother Chiyo, with Sakura's help, managed to destroy his puppet body. Sasori chose not to dodge the final blow.

Kakuzu.summary: Akatsuki Suppression arc. Kakuzu's multiple hearts and elemental combinations overwhelmed Asuma's Guardian Shinobi techniques.
Kakashi destroyed one heart with Lightning Blade but couldn't handle all five. Naruto arrived to finish the fight.
Naruto's Rasenshuriken destroyed two of Kakuzu's hearts simultaneously, and Kakashi finished him with Lightning Blade.
Kakuzu was sent to assassinate the First Hokage but barely escaped alive, taking Hashirama's heart as his first extra heart.

Hidan.summary: Hidan used his Jashin ritual after ingesting Asuma's blood, creating a link to kill Asuma by stabbing himself.
Shikamaru separated Hidan from Kakuzu and trapped him with explosives, burying the immortal alive forever in the Nara forest.
Hidan and Kakuzu captured the Two-Tails jinchūriki Yugito after a difficult battle where she transformed fully.

Nagato.summary: Jiraiya infiltrated Rain to investigate Pain. He killed three Paths but was overwhelmed by all six, dying after discovering Pain's secret.
The Deva Path fought Kakashi during the Konoha invasion. Kakashi used Kamui but died from chakra exhaustion.
Naruto mastered Sage Mode and defeated all Six Paths, then convinced Nagato to believe in peace again. Nagato sacrificed himself to revive the dead.
Hinata tried to protect Naruto and confessed her love, but Pain defeated her easily, triggering Naruto's Six-Tails transformation.
Pain captured the Six-Tails jinchūriki Utakata for Akatsuki.

Konan.summary: Konan fought alongside Nagato against their former teacher, helping to overwhelm the Sannin with the Six Paths.
Konan prepared 600 billion paper bombs to kill Obito but he survived using Izanagi, then killed her to take Nagato's Rinnegan.

Obito Uchiha.summary: Nine-Tails attack on Konoha. Minato's Flying Thunder God outmaneuvered Obito's Kamui, hitting him with Rasengan and freeing Kurama.
Obito survived Konan's 600 billion paper bomb ambush using Izanagi, then killed her and took Nagato's Rinnegan.
Obito placed the Fourth Mizukage under genjutsu, controlling the Bloody Mist Village for years.
Naruto's words and the Allied Forces broke Obito's will. He eventually abandoned the Eye of the Moon plan and helped seal Kaguya.
Former teammates battled in the Kamui dimension. Kakashi stabbed Obito, winning their emotional fight over ideals and the past.

Zabuza Momochi.summary: Land of Waves. Kakashi's Sharingan copied Zabuza's techniques. In their final battle, Zabuza died killing Gato's men after Haku's death.
Zabuza took Haku as his tool after finding him, training him in the art of killing. Haku died protecting Zabuza by choice.

Haku.summary: Haku's ice mirrors trapped Sasuke and Naruto. Sasuke awakened his Sharingan but was seemingly killed protecting Naruto.
Naruto's Nine-Tails chakra awakened and overwhelmed Haku, but Naruto couldn't bring himself to kill after seeing Haku's face.
Haku died by jumping in front of Kakashi's Lightning Blade meant for Zabuza, sacrificing himself for his master.

Kimimaro.summary: Kimimaro's bone techniques overwhelmed the recovering Lee, who was still affected by his surgery and drunken fist wore off.
Gaara's sand trapped Kimimaro underground. Kimimaro's illness killed him just as his bone spear was about to pierce Gaara's face.
Kimimaro defeated Naruto before Lee arrived, protecting Sasuke's barrel during the retrieval mission.

Kidōmaru.summary: Kidōmaru analyzed Neji's Byakugan blind spot and nearly killed him with a guided arrow, but Neji struck his heart despite fatal wounds.

Tayuya.summary: Shikamaru's Shadow Possession trapped Tayuya after clever strategy, but Temari arrived to deliver the killing blow.
Temari's Summoning: Quick Beheading Dance destroyed the forest and killed Tayuya, saving Shikamaru.

Jirōbō.summary: Choji used the three Akimichi pills to achieve Butterfly Mode, killing Jirōbō with a massive Butterfly Bullet Bombing punch.

Sakon and Ukon.summary: The twins' kekkei genkai nearly killed Kiba by merging into his body. Kiba and Akamaru were saved by Kankurō's arrival.
Kankurō's Black Ant puppet crushed Sakon and Ukon together, killing both twins in his iron maiden trap.

Hiruzen Sarutobi.summary: The Third Hokage used Reaper Death Seal to steal Orochimaru's arms and soul, dying in the process during Konoha Crush.

Minato Namikaze.summary: Minato used Flying Thunder God to outmaneuver Obito's Kamui, striking him with Rasengan and a contract seal to free Kurama.
Third Shinobi War encounter. A and B attacked Minato, but his Flying Thunder God teleportation was too fast even for A's speed.
Minato's Flying Thunder God placed a mark on B during their encounter, though no decisive winner emerged.

Tobirama Senju.summary: Multiple battles during the Warring States period. Tobirama killed Izuna Uchiha but never definitively defeated Madara himself.

A (Fourth Raikage).summary: Five Kage Summit. A lost his arm trying to break through Susanoo but was stopped by Gaara before killing Sasuke.
A tried to stop Naruto from joining the war. Naruto dodged his fastest punch using Nine-Tails Chakra Mode, proving his growth.
Third Shinobi War. A and B fought Minato but couldn't land a hit on his Flying Thunder God speed.

Killer B.summary: B decapitated Kisame with Lariat, though it was a clone. Later, B helped capture the real Kisame at the Falls of Truth.
B trained Naruto to control the Nine-Tails through intense sparring, with both pushing each other to new limits.
B overwhelmed Taka with Eight-Tails power, only pretending to be captured to escape from Kumo's responsibilities.
Minato placed a Flying Thunder God mark on B during their Third Shinobi War encounter.

Ōnoki.summary: Fourth Shinobi War. Ōnoki fought his former master's Edo Tensei form, sealing him after a difficult battle.
Five Kage were overwhelmed by Madara's Perfect Susanoo and Wood Clone army despite Ōnoki's Particle Style.

Mei Terumī.summary: Five Kage Summit. Mei's Lava and Boil Release techniques threatened Sasuke's Susanoo but the fight was interrupted.
The Five Kage were defeated by Madara's overwhelming power despite their combined abilities.

Gengetsu Hōzuki.summary: Fourth Shinobi War. Gaara discovered the Second Mizukage's weakness and sealed him after an extended battle.
Fourth Shinobi War. The Kage worked together to seal Edo Tensei Gengetsu.

Danzō Shimura.summary: Sasuke hunted Danzō for ordering the Uchiha massacre. After exhausting Izanagi, Danzō failed to take Sasuke with him.
Danzō stole Shisui's eye to prevent him from using Kotoamatsukami, leading to Shisui's suicide and giving his other eye to Itachi.

Kabuto Yakushi.summary: Kabuto absorbed Orochimaru's remains and consciousness, integrating his powers and eventually becoming the dominant personality.
Kabuto's regeneration abilities couldn't overcome Tsunade's medical knowledge and superhuman strength.
Edo Tensei Itachi trapped Kabuto in Izanami, forcing him to release the reanimation jutsu and accept his true self.
Sasuke and Itachi worked together to defeat Kabuto's Sage Mode, with Itachi ultimately sealing him.
Their battles left both damaged but alive. Naruto's Rasengan hit Kabuto but his regeneration saved him.
Encounters where neither achieved decisive victory in direct combat.

Chiyo.summary: Chiyo and Sakura destroyed Sasori's puppet body. Chiyo used her knowledge of his techniques, and Sasori chose not to dodge the final blow.

Anko Mitarashi.summary: Orochimaru easily defeated his former student during the Chūnin Exams, her Curse Mark being a pale shadow of his power.
Kabuto captured Anko for her Curse Mark during the Fourth Shinobi War, using her to strengthen the Edo Tensei.

Temari.summary: Chūnin Exams preliminaries. Temari's wind techniques completely nullified Tenten's weapons, winning without any difficulty.
Chūnin Exams finals. Shikamaru strategically outplayed Temari but forfeited due to chakra exhaustion despite winning position.
Temari arrived to save Shikamaru, using Summoning: Quick Beheading Dance to destroy the forest and kill Tayuya.

Kankurō.summary: Chūnin Exams. Kankurō forfeited when Shino's bugs had already infiltrated his puppets and body, fearing being consumed.
Kankurō was easily defeated and poisoned by his puppet predecessor during the Gaara rescue arc.
Kankurō's Black Ant puppet crushed the twin brothers, saving Kiba and Akamaru from certain death.

Madara Uchiha.summary: Final Valley. Hashirama killed Madara in their legendary battle, though Madara had prepared for resurrection using Izanagi.
Guy opened all Eight Gates and nearly killed Madara with Night Guy. Madara called him the strongest taijutsu user ever.
Naruto with Six Paths Sage Mode fought Madara, who ultimately became the vessel for Kaguya's resurrection.
Multiple battles during the Warring States period. Tobirama killed Izuna but never defeated Madara himself.

Hashirama Senju.summary: Final Valley. Hashirama's Wood Release and Sage Mode defeated Madara and Kurama, establishing Konoha's dominance.
Kakuzu was sent to assassinate Hashirama but barely escaped alive, taking Hashirama's heart to survive.

Kaguya Ōtsutsuki.summary: Naruto and Sasuke sealed Kaguya with Six Paths — Chibaku Tensei after an extended battle across dimensions.
Sasuke's Rinnegan dimension-shifting was crucial to cornering Kaguya for the final seal alongside Naruto.

Mū.summary: Fourth Shinobi War. Ōnoki sealed his former master after exploiting the weakness of his fission technique.
Gaara and the Allied Forces worked together to seal the Second Tsuchikage during the war.

A (Third Raikage).summary: Naruto used Sage Mode to redirect the Third Raikage's Hell Stab into his own body, exploiting the scar on his chest.

Rasa.summary: Orochimaru killed the Fourth Kazekage and impersonated him to manipulate Sand Village into attacking Konoha.

Fugaku Uchiha.summary: Fugaku allowed Itachi to kill him and his wife during the Uchiha massacre, accepting his son's painful choice.

Shisui Uchiha.summary: Danzō stole Shisui's right eye to prevent Kotoamatsukami. Shisui gave his left eye to Itachi and committed suicide.

Yagura Karatachi.summary: Obito placed the Fourth Mizukage under his genjutsu, using him to control the Bloody Mist Village for years.

Utakata.summary: Pain captured the Six-Tails jinchūriki Utakata for Akatsuki's Ten-Tails revival plan.

Yugito Nii.summary: Hidan and Kakuzu captured the Two-Tails jinchūriki after a difficult fight where Yugito fully transformed.

Rōshi.summary: Kisame captured the Four-Tails jinchūriki Rōshi for Akatsuki, overwhelming his Lava Release with Samehada.

Han.summary: Deidara captured the Five-Tails jinchūriki Han for Akatsuki using his explosive clay techniques.

Fū.summary: The Seven-Tails jinchūriki Fū was captured by Akatsuki. The exact battle details were not shown.

Hanzō.summary: Second Shinobi War. The Sannin survived against Hanzō, who was so impressed he spared them and gave them their title.
